title: Windows2unix conversion error on colab
body:
I receive an error related to data structure when trying to create a training data set after migrating from windows to google colab. I modify my config.yaml following the colab guide and move my labeled data - DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.8.2 - Browser: Chrome Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.: 4. the input code you used: deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file) 4. See error:
TRACEBACK

There are many more functions you can set here, including which netowkr to use! 3 #check the docstring for full options you can do! ----> 4 deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file) 3 frames /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in create_training_dataset(config, num_shuffles, Shuffles, windows2linux, userfeedback, trainIndexes, testIndexes, net_type, augmenter_type) 632 auxiliaryfunctions.attempttomakefolder(Path(os.path.join(project_path,str(trainingsetfolder))),recursive=True) 633 --> 634 Data = merge_annotateddatasets(cfg,project_path,Path(os.path.join(project_path,trainingsetfolder)),windows2linux) 635 Data = Data[scorer] #extract labeled data 636 /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in merge_annotateddatasets(cfg, project_path, trainingsetfolder_full, windows2linux) 410 return 411 --> 412 AnnotationData = pd.concat(AnnotationData).sort_index() 413 # When concatenating DataFrames with misaligned column labels, 414 # all sorts of reordering may happen (mainly depending on 'sort' and 'join') /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pandas/core/reshape/concat.py in concat(objs, axis, join, ignore_index, keys, levels, names, verify_integrity, sort, copy) 279 verify_integrity=verify_integrity, 280 copy=copy, --> 281 sort=sort, 282 ) 283 /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pandas/core/reshape/concat.py in __init__(self, objs, axis, join, keys, levels, names, ignore_index, verify_integrity, copy, sort) 307 "first argument must be an iterable of pandas " 308 "objects, you passed an object of type " --> 309 '"{name}"'.format(name=type(objs).__name__) 310 ) 311 TypeError: first argument must be an iterable of pandas objects, you passed an object of type "DataFrame" ```

**Expected behavior** Program terminated while converting annotated data from windows to unix. I can see that it found the correct folders for the labeled data but giving me an error after that. **Screenshots** Here's my folder structure on the drive: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22876046/93906067-bd227700-fcc9-11ea-9b74-75df9fa035e4.png) *training datasets folder is empty and videos folder has fake links. Here's my config.yaml ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22876046/93905998-a3812f80-fcc9-11ea-94b2-5d6a7d047181.png)
